title.narrative: Innovating Pathways for Employment Inclusion

description.narrative: Innovating Pathways for Employment Inclusion (IPEI) IPEI will develop, test, validate, and share learning from interventions that will increase employment of people with disabilities

Outcome: Increased economic empowerment and wellbeing of women and men with disabilities through an enabling gender transformative environment and technology-supported solutions in the target countries. Output 1: Inclusive national systems and policies strengthen the disability ecosystem to support equal access to waged employment for women and men with disabilities in the target countries Output 2: A supportive private sector creating inclusive employment opportunities for women and men with disabilities in the target countries Output 3: People with disabilities, particularly women with disabilities, have increased opportunities to engage in decent waged employment, including in the digital economy Output 4: Aid Connect Disability Inclusion consortia coordinate initiatives, including in-country programming in Bangladesh and Kenya, to catalyse increased action and investment in disability inclusion by promoting evidence-based decision making.
People with Disabilities Disabled People's Organisations Vocational Training Centres Private sector employers Government Ministries

sector.narrative: The project will analyse employment policies in Kenya and Bangladesh and work with employers to improve accessibility and health and safety
The project will analyse social protection policies in Kenya and Bangladesh and create an Access to Work scheme for people with disabilities
The project will create apprenticeships and job placements in private companies for people with disabilities.
The project will work with TVET institutions to improve disability inclusion, and will provide soft skills training

target.value: Bangladesh: 2,000 people with disabilities, including 800 women with disabilities, with increased confidence and competence. Kenya: 1,000 people with disabilities, including 400 women with disabilities, with increased confidence and competence

title.narrative: A supportive private sector creating inclusive employment opportunities for women and men with disabilities in the target countries

target.value: Bangladesh: At least 60 senior business leaders make and endorse a commitment to inclusive employment; Kenya: At least 40 senior business leaders endorse their commitment to inclusive employment.

title.narrative: A supportive private sector creating inclusive employment opportunities for women and men with disabilities in the target countries

Number and proportion of targeted private companies with policies and practices (including adhering to safeguarding principles) following disability and gender inclusion assessment to enable women and men with disabilities enjoy equal rights in the workplaces.

target.value: Bangladesh: all 50 targeted companies have supportive policies and safe workplaces for people with disabilities especially women with disabilities. Kenya: all 30 targeted companies meet the 1% quota of jobs for people with disabilities by ensuring systems and policies are supportive for people with disabilities.
